title: Project Initiation
description: Kick off the project, gather requirements, and define the project scope and objectives.

title: System Architecture Design for CombatantIdentificationSystem
description:
Design the overall system architecture for the CombatantIdentificationSystem, including:
1. AI model design focusing on accuracy, real-time processing, and scalability (consider transfer learning and ensemble methods for faster training and improved performance).
2. Efficient multi-spectral imaging pipeline, considering performance optimization, fault tolerance, and researching on potential compression techniques like wavelet compression.
3. Data processing components that are modular, maintainable, and adaptable to evolving battlefield conditions, ensuring efficient data flow and implementing asynchronous processing for error handling.
4. Integration with existing military systems, ensuring seamless interoperability and providing APIs for smooth communication, also considering the use of gRPC or RESTful APIs for better performance.
5. Scalability considerations including edge cases, error handling, and ethical requirements in the design, with a focus on distributed computing for large-scale applications.
6. Compliance with relevant laws and regulations regarding the use of AI in military applications, with a focus on data privacy and security, also considering the need for anonymization and pseudonymization techniques.
7. Documentation of the architecture and its components for future maintenance and improvements, including clear and concise technical documentation as well as user manuals.
8. Assign specific team members to each component for efficient development, clearly defining roles and responsibilities.

title: Data Collection and Preparation
description: Collect and prepare the necessary data for training the AI model and testing the system.

title: AI Model Development
description: Develop and train the AI model for combatant identification using the collected data.

title: Multi-spectral Imaging Pipeline
description: Implement the multi-spectral imaging pipeline for capturing and processing battlefield data.

title: User Interface Design (Revised)
description: Revise the user interface design for the system, focusing on efficient visualizations and intuitive control interfaces for operators to interact with the system, view, analyze, and manage identified combatants. Incorporate feedback from User Experience Research, ensure compatibility with System Architecture Design, emphasize responsiveness and adaptability to various screen sizes. Also, consider accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG 2.1) for users with disabilities. Furthermore, prioritize clear documentation of the UI design choices made during the revision process, to facilitate future updates and collaboration among team members.

title: System Integration and Testing
description: Integrate the AI model, multi-spectral imaging pipeline, and user interface components, and perform thorough testing.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Ensure the system meets all necessary security and compliance requirements for handling sensitive data and battlefield operations.

title: Deployment and Operations
description: Plan and implement the deployment and ongoing operations of the system in the target environment.

title: Documentation and Training
description: Develop comprehensive documentation and training materials for system users and administrators.
